name: Thinking about buying EE for my iPad
author: Theophilus Fist

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
New to Mac and never played EE - strictly DE on GOG.  

1 - Is anyone here playing the game on iPad?

2 - What are the key differences between EE and Diamond Edition?

Putting it on my iPad will allow me to play while travelling on airplanes (which I won't be doing until COVID-19 is under control, but in normal times I'd travel frequently for business).

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hey Theo!

This section is destined for General character-building related discussions (that's why it's in the Character Building section). If you don't mind, I'll move the topic to the General section of the NWN World forums.

So many generals it can get confusing sometimes, I know!

About your question, I know there are a few differences between EE and Diamond NWN. The ones I know off the top of my head are:

1- Assassins no longer fire Death Attacks on all attacks in the first flurry. Only 1 paralysis attempt will be made on the first attack.

2- The Dispel magic formula has been fixed, so now you need 25 Caster Levels to be immune to Greater Dispelling.

3- They un-hardcoded CEP weapons, which allowed some servers / PWs to add Weapon Focus feats for CEP weapons. This is not available for Single Player AFAIK.

4- Graphics are KILLER LOL

About the Ipad, I really have no idea. I know Asturo played from his phone, so I presume it's doable.

Cheers!

posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
I almost exclusively play on a ~6" display on a LG V40, mostly out of convenience (and because my 6y.o. stole my laptop for Among Us). There are plenty of little things that are annoying about it like...
- you can't hover over something to see what it is, 
- moving is "point there, go there" unless the pathfinding fails or companions block you (there's an invisible floating Dpad on the left side of the screen that can help a bit)
- talking to other players in PWs is hard with the keyboard popping up ruining, to name a few. 
- Plus it seems to be a major battery hog once you've installed CEP and other large mods/haks thereby consuming much of your device's memory (I've had sporadic luck installing onto an external SD. It worked but it's a PITA getting the mods, haks, erf, bifs, movs to the right folders)
- When the last major update (8193?) finally came to Android, it wiped everything including numerous save games.
- Expect to be ~6 months behind PC updates (loosing access to any PWs that update)
- Sales exclude the additional "offical" content like Moonsea, Daggerdale, etc as they are in-app content without price reductions
- I've played on my kids' Samsung Tab A (2019). It's not a powerhouse and the performance shows. But maybe Apple does better with older iPads?
- Yes, the tiny print on the phone screen has probably aged my eyes more rapidly than necessary 

But !!!
- the portability is AWESOME!!!!!! (I can't stress this enough and more than makes up for the price of admission, especially when it goes on sale for $5)
- playing PWs is possible
- mods work
- did I say it was awesome? Because it is so fracking AWESOME to play it anywhere you take your phone/tablet. Car rides? Check. Morning constitutionals? Check. During work meetings (much better when they're on Zoom :P)? Check.

Plenty of little nits, but man oh man is it worth it.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
On a non-technical level, it might be worth noting that Stunning Fist duration has been reduced to 1 round (from 3). Also, for Monk, you can only use it once per day per Monk level, regardless of whether other classes might have added more uses.

Cheers
